On 1/27/2016 at 8:19 AM, Evanitis said:

Yay, thanks!

Ok, I put about 10 hours into Sol-0 and my opinion of it is pretty poor.  For a game, it seems to be missing the element of "fun".  There is a lot of usability problems and the game just isn't polished - it feels like something that was built by an amateur over the weekend on Unity with stuff they purchased on the asset store or made themselves in Microsoft Paint.

As far as a gameplay comparison, Sol-0 is very slow paced and you control individual units by instructing them to build things.  This doesn't sound bad, but you spend more time watching your units walk around than actually doing anything fun or engaging.  The game's concept of time is also problematic - upon landing with a full supply of food, you've got less than five minutes of gameplay time to build a whole bunch of stuff before you starve to death even after sending multiple pre-arrival supply drops of food.

The idea of the game is good, but it's got so many usability issues that make it feel more like doing a chore than playing a game.

My recommendation is to save your $6 and try Planetbase or something else instead.
I like Sol 0, it's fun and the dev is adding stuff. Now to be on topic, I moght get Planetbase, it looks kind of fun from the few things I've seen of it.
